title: Quiz 9: Referral and Networking
description: Understanding the referral system, networking benefits, and overcoming constraints.

questions.question: What is the definition of a 'Network' in the context of HBC?

options.text: A computer system used in the hospital
A group of individuals/organisations working together to strengthen individual capacities
A single NGO working in isolation

questions.explanation: A network is a collaborative group working together or exchanging information to achieve common goals.

questions.question: What are the advantages of networking? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Networking reduces isolation and duplication, while promoting support and consultation.

questions.question: Referral is a one-way process where the hospital sends the patient home and forgets about them.
questions.explanation: Referral is an effective and efficient TWO-WAY process (Hospital to Home, Home to Hospital) that requires feedback.

questions.question: Order the steps of referring a patient:

items.text: Explain to patient and prepare them
Fill referral form and obtain escort

questions.explanation: Identify -> Arrange -> Explain -> Execute (Form/Escort) -> Follow up.
questions.hint: Logical flow of sending someone away.

questions.question: Why might a patient be referred? (Select all that apply)

options.text: When services within reach cannot meet immediate needs
For specialised care in a hospital setting
To punish the patient for non-compliance

questions.explanation: Referral is based on need (resources, specialization, caregiver fatigue), never punishment.

questions.question: A referral form should include patient particulars, disease condition, reason for referral, care provided, and a note requesting for ___BLANK___.
questions.explanation: Feedback is essential to complete the two-way referral loop.

questions.question: Which of the following is a constraint/limitation in networking?

options.text: Competition among organizations leading to lack of disclosure

questions.explanation: Competition and working in isolation prevent effective networking.

questions.question: What is one solution to the constraint of 'Lack of knowledge by people referring'?
questions.explanation: Solutions include training, providing guidelines/directories, and collaborative meetings.
questions.hint: How do you fix a lack of knowledge?
